channel.title: Hypercam VS. Camtasia VS. FRAPS
channel.description:
Which is better?
Hypercam or Camtasia or FRAPS

item.title: Hypercam VS. Camtasia VS. FRAPS
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I know your not asking for this but Microsoft Encoder is really good. Full HD, the free version limits you to 10mins of recording per one sitting though. Max fps is 60 i think. All round good, I use it all the time.
Bit annoying how you’ve got to ‘encode’ the file though as it saves the file as a .xesc I think however since its made my Microsoft you know its pretty good.
I need to buy the paid version sometime, theres some nice features in the paid version. If you want to use it, don’t forget to encode it as best quality for the best results ;d.

Read full topic

item.title: Hypercam VS. Camtasia VS. FRAPS
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I feel like there is a lot to learn in this topic.

First of all, Hypercam’s “shit quality” has nothing to do with it being hypercam. Its default settings use low quality lossy compression algorithms. You can change it to use maximum quality in raw format, and it’ll have just as good quality as any other recorder.

The reason the files get so large is because they are uncompressed and retain 100% of their original colors. For all purposes, if your computer can handle it, this is the superior choice (regardless of what program you use–all the programs do is take a screenshot, who cares what it’s called?) You can then decide what sort of compression algorithm you wish to use and re-encode it, using something such as media coder (which is my personal preference, since it is excellent).

It’s worth noting that there are lossy compression algorithms that are very good at retaining most of the quality (such as xvid). These are generally unavailable to simply recorders, or they are used poorly. Furthermore, by recording in raw format, you are able to distribute the video in multiple qualities (which is especially useful nowadays).

So my answer to the topic…it shouldn’t matter yo.

Read full topic

item.title: Hypercam VS. Camtasia VS. FRAPS
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:22, topic:432643”]Fraps.

Why? Because Camtasia lags like a mother fucker and is a shitty video editing software.
Hypercam is for 12 year olds.[/quote]YES
Camtasia is a terrible video editor, and a shitty screen recorder
If you look forward to record games like runescape and flash games use Hypercam
if you are playing top class games like bf3, mw3, Wow, runescape (in fullscreen and detailed) etc Use fraps

item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:22, topic:432643”]Fraps.

Why? Because Camtasia lags like a mother fucker and is a shitty video editing software.
Hypercam is for 12 year olds.[/quote]

I have the shittiest computer ever and Camtasia doesn’t lag at all. And I really don’t think that Hypercam is for 12 year olds, but the quality is shit. And the last time I tried to use fraps was nearly 5 years ago, and I was never patient enough to get it working back then so I’m not even going to try now.
